background: A client expresses unrealistic hopes and desires during therapy sessions.
pre_reasoning: When clients express improbable or impossible outcomes as their goals, it is important to reframe these unrealistic goals to uncover their underlying needs or desires. This can be achieved by exploring what these unrealistic goals would do for or mean to the clients.

dialog.text: What is your best hope for our meeting today?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist initiates the session by inquiring about the client's aspirations.

dialog.text: I want my parents to get back together again.
dialog.observation: Client expresses an unrealistic desire for their parents to reconcile.

dialog.text: What would having your parents back together again do for you?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist aims to uncover the underlying need or desire behind the client's unrealistic goal.

dialog.text: I’d be able to talk to my dad every day.
dialog.observation: Client reveals the importance of regular communication with their father.

dialog.text: So being able to talk to your dad every day would be your hope?
dialog.observation: Therapist reframes the unrealistic goal into a positive aspiration related to improved communication.
Client acknowledges the positive aspect of the reframed goal.

dialog.text: So when you are talking to your dad every day, what would you have done to make that happen?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist encourages the client to elaborate on the steps needed to achieve the positive goal.

dialog.text: I would have set up a regular time to call my dad before I go to bed.
dialog.observation: Client outlines a specific action plan to facilitate regular communication with their father.

dialog.text: What is your best hope for our meeting today?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist continues to explore the client's aspirations for the session.

dialog.text: I don’t want to be HIV positive.
dialog.observation: Client expresses a desire to avoid a specific health condition.

dialog.text: What’s the reason that is so important to you?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist delves into the significance of the client's goal to avoid being HIV positive.

dialog.text: Because then I would feel more comfortable hanging around with my friends like I used to.
dialog.observation: Client links avoiding HIV positivity to regaining comfort in social interactions.

dialog.text: So feeling comfortable hanging around with your friends is something you would like to accomplish?
dialog.observation: Therapist reframes the client's goal into a positive desire for improved social comfort.
Client expresses agreement with the positive reframing of their goal.

dialog.text: What would you be doing that would show that you are more comfortable when you are with your friends?
dialog.reasoning: Therapist prompts the client to elaborate on behaviors indicating increased comfort in social situations.
